body:
`spack spec emacs+X` says:

```
Input spec
--------------------------------
emacs+X

Normalized
--------------------------------
emacs+X
    ^giflib
    ^libpng
        ^zlib@1.0.4:
    ^libtiff
        ^jpeg
        ^xz
    ^libx11
        ^inputproto
            ^pkg-config@0.9.0:
            ^util-macros
        ^kbproto
        ^libxcb@1.1.92:
            ^libpthread-stubs
            ^libxau@0.99.2:
                ^xproto@7.0.17:
            ^libxdmcp
            ^python@2:2.8
                ^bzip2
                ^ncurses
                ^openssl
                ^readline
                ^sqlite
            ^xcb-proto
        ^xextproto
        ^xtrans
    ^libxpm
        ^gettext

Concretized
--------------------------------
emacs@25.2%gcc@5.4.0+X toolkit=gtk arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
    ^giflib@5.1.4%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
    ^libpng@1.6.29%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
        ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@5.4.0+pic+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
    ^libtiff@4.0.7%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
        ^jpeg@9b%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
        ^xz@5.2.3%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
    ^libx11@1.6.5%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
        ^inputproto@2.3.2%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
            ^pkg-config@0.29.2%gcc@5.4.0+internal_glib arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
            ^util-macros@1.19.1%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
        ^kbproto@1.0.7%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
        ^libxcb@1.12%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
            ^libpthread-stubs@0.4%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
            ^libxau@1.0.8%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
                ^xproto@7.0.31%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
            ^libxdmcp@1.1.2%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
            ^python@2.7.13%gcc@5.4.0+shared~tk~ucs4 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
                ^bzip2@1.0.6%gcc@5.4.0+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
                ^ncurses@6.0%gcc@5.4.0~symlinks arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
                ^openssl@1.0.2k%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
                ^readline@7.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
                ^sqlite@3.18.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
            ^xcb-proto@1.12%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
        ^xextproto@7.3.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
        ^xtrans@1.3.5%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
    ^libxpm@3.5.12%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
        ^gettext@0.19.8.1%gcc@5.4.0+bzip2+curses+git~libunistring+libxml2+tar+xz arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
            ^libxml2@2.9.4%gcc@5.4.0~python arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
            ^tar@1.29%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
```

There's no dependency on `gtkplus+X`.

The emacs package spec sez:

```
  depends_on('libxaw', when='+X toolkit=athena')
  depends_on('gtkplus+X', when='+X toolkit=gtk')
```

On a whim, I also tried:

```
  depends_on('libxaw', when='toolkit=athena')
  depends_on('gtkplus+X', when='toolkit=gtk')
```

with the same result.
title: Emacs not picking up gtkplus dependency (multi-valued variants problem?)
